shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” (fols. 2ra-126vb) I-1) ʾƎsäggǝd lä-mäläkotǝkä... “I worship Thy Godhead…” (2ra-3vb) I-2) Introduction (fols. 4ra-10va) - On John the Evangelist as the author of the book; on the creation and the fall of the angels (fols. 4ra-7ra) - Story of the family of Adam (fols. 7ra-10va) I-3) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 70 miracles (fols. 10va-121vb) I-4) Correspondence between King Abgar and Jesus; the story of the martyrs of Akmim (fols. 121vb-126vb) (ed. S. GRÉBAUT, "Les relations entre Abgar et Jésus", ROC 21, 1918-19, 73-87; "La mort des martyrs d'Akmim", ibid. 92-93).
Additiones 1-3.

copyists.copyist: The scribe mentions his name in the colophon.

donors.donor: The names of many individuals are mentioned in the supplication formulas: Wäldä Krǝstos (fols. 7ra, 9va, 10va, 10vb, 12rb, 14va, etc.), Wäldä Samuʾel (fols. 12rb, 13vb, 19ra, 25vb, 29rb, etc.), Wälättä Maryam (fols. 14va, 18rb, 26va, 32rb, 35rb, etc.), Wälättä Kidan (fols. 32ra, 35ra, 39vb, 40vb, 44ra, etc.), Gäbrä Krǝstos (fol. 4ra), Täwäldä Tǝnśaʾe (fols. 5rb, 8vb), Haylä Maryam (fol. 28rb).

txstates.txstate: A half of fol. 127 is cut off. Fol. 128 has a large blot in the upper outer part, which makes the text partly illegible. Tears carefully mended on fols. 37, 38, 50, 55, 93, 104, 113, 117.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Threads of endband sewing are partly missing. Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(3/s. l.: 3, stub before 1/fols. 1r-3v) – ፩I(8/fols. 4r-11v) – ፪II(8/fols. 12r-19v) – ፫III(8/fols. 20r-27v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 28r-35v) – ፭V(8/fols. 36r-43v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 44r-51v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 52r-59v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 60r-67v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 68r-75v) – ፲X(8/fols. 76r-83v) – ፲፩XI(8/fols. 84r-91v) – ፲፪XII(8/fols. 92r-99v) – ፲፫XIII(8/fols. 100r-107v) – ፲፬XIV(8/fols. 108r-115v) – ፲፭XV(8/fols. 116r-123v) – ፲፮XVI(6/fols. 124r-129v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible. Ruling pricks are mostly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: poor, hand b: mediocre.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 2ra-3vb (text I-1) hand b: fols. 4ra-126vb (text I-2, I-3, I-4)

abbreviations.abbreviation: ለዓለ፡ ዓለ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ (fol. 5rb, 30ra, 47va, 64rb, 94vb) ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ (fols. 6va, 8va, 13vb, 14va, 18rb, etc.) ለዓመ፡ ዓለ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ (fol. 10vb) ለዓ፡ ዓለም፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ (fol. 37va) አሜ፡ for አሜን፡ (fols. 5rb, 6va, 8va, 9va, 13vb, etc.) አ፡ for አሜን፡ (fol. 36ra) እሰግ፡ for እሰግድ፡ (fol. 128rb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: The miracles of Text I-2 are numbered (starting from the second miracle, which is given the number 2); the first miracle of Text I-3 has the number 8. Text I-4) is divided into two chapters (mǝʕraf), each numbered as a separate miracle (furthermore, the word ክፍል “part” and a line dividing the second chapter into two parts were recently inserted on fol. 124vb). The miracles are introduced with the word täʾamǝr “miracle”, rarely zǝkr “memory”.

colophon.det: The rhymed colophon is written in the main hand. The scribe calls himself Gäbrä Mäsqäl.

additional.cont: Fol. 128r. The first page of ˀƎsäggəd lä-mäläkotəkä... “I worship Thy Godhead…” (cp. fol. 2ra). Written In a secondary hand, the writing is worn out and partly illegible.
Fol. 129v. A short note in Amharic, mostly illegible.

extras.extra: - Scribbles, in recent hand, in the upper margin: fol. 49va - Scribbles and doodles, in recent hand: fol. 129r - Doodles, in recent hand: fol. 128v - Pen trials and writing exercises: fols. 1r, 1v - Omitted letters, words written interlineally, in the main hand: fols. 5va, 21rb, 45vb, 120va - Omitted word written on the outer margin: fol. 91va - Words to be erased marked with thin lines (red or black) above and below the word: fol2. 14va, 18rb, 26va, 35rb, 45va, 49va, 52ra, etc. - Words to be erased marked with red dots at each corner of the word: fol. 89rb

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks, written in the upper left margin: fol. 4r, 12r, etc.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid:
Daily readings for Text I-1 are indicated by the days of the week written in the upper margin, in a hand similar to the main hand (dark tangelo ink): ዘሰኑይ: fol. 2va ዘረቡዕ: fol. 3ra ዘሀሙስ: fol. 3rb ዘሠሉስ: fol. 3va or in pencil, in a secondary (recent) hand: ዘሠሉስ: fol. 2vb
Titles of miracles or feasts or time of day indicating respective readings are written in the upper margin in the main hand (red ink, with decorations): ዘልደት፡ fol. 12rb ዘደብረ፡ ዘይት፡ fol. 54vb ዘጥምቀት፡ fol. 58vb ዘቃና፡ ዘገሊላ፡ fol. 60vb ዘሆሣዕና፡ fol. 87ra ዘጸሎተ፡ ሐሙስ፡ fol. 91rb ዘንዋም፡ fol. 93ra ዘመንፈቀ፡ ሌሊት፡ fol. 94vb ዘነግህ፡ fol. 96vb ዘ፫ሰዓት፡ fol. 98rb ዘቀትር፡ fol. 99ra ዘ፱ሰዓት፡ fol. 100ra ዘቀዳም፡ fol. 101ra ዘእሑድ፡ fol. 102va ዘፈጸምነ፡ fol. 114va ዘዕርገት፡ fol. 115vb ዘበዓለ፡ ፶፡ fol. 118rb
or in a hand similar to the main hand (dark tangelo or black ink): ዘልደት፡ fol. 14va ዘሰንበት፡ fol. 78rb
or in a secondary (recent) hand: ዘቁስቋም፡ fol. 21rb ዘደብረ ታቦር; fol. 27va ዘጻድቃን: fol. 74ra (in pencil) ስለ፡ ሐዲስ፡ መስዋዕት፡ fol. 82r
In the upper margin of fol. 10v (text I-2), the date is indicated, in a hand similar to the main hand (dark tangelo ink): አመ፡ ፫ ለታሕሣሥ: fol. 10v
A title of a miracle (?) is blotted out on fol. 57r
